posts.post_content: Wooden Sphere has been around since 4th edition and the fact that it's an uncommon has me scratching my head. There are much better life gain artifacts out there. The only plus is it could be used as infinite life gain in a card engine. Although if you have a combo giving infinite mana you can probably do something better then life gain.

posts.post_content: Wow, you guys need to call Wizards of the Coast and ask them about this card. Wooden Sphere was part of the orginal, strong, awesome MTG cards for a reason. Unlike Kraken's Eye or other cards where one life is automatically triggered by playing a certain color spell, Wooden Sphere allows you to use ALL of your open mana for 1 life each. Amazingly awesome lifegain ability, especailly in green!!!
posts.html:

Posted By: A3Kitsune (2/3/2010 1:33:00 AM)

posts.post_content:
This is one of those cards that makes you grit your teeth when you see it reprinted, because 99% of new players misunderstand the mechanic and become disappointed or angry when you explain it to them.  
  
"What do you *mean* I can't gain 6 life off my [Llanowar Elves](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Llanowar Elves) by tapping down all my forests? It never says you can do this only once per spell!!!" Redundant or no, I really wish they'd print "Activate this ability only once per spell" on it.
posts.html:
This is one of those cards that makes you grit your teeth when you see it reprinted, because 99% of new players misunderstand the mechanic and become disappointed or angry when you explain it to them.

"What do you mean I can't gain 6 life off my Llanowar Elves by tapping down all my forests? It never says you can do this only once per spell!!!" Redundant or no, I really wish they'd print "Activate this ability only once per spell" on it.
